thread.title: MEA verifying reports of 20 Indians killed by Saudi-led air strikes on Yemen’s Hodeidah port
thread.title_full: MEA verifying reports of 20 Indians killed by Saudi-led air strikes on Yemen’s Hodeidah port | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: MEA verifying reports of 20 Indians killed by Saudi-led air strikes on Yemen’s Hodeidah port
text:
Other Articles Dena Bank attaches property of Hardik Patel's aide British Airways plane catches fire in Las Vegas, two minor injuries Over 100 US academics say Narendra Modi supporters posting threats on blogs At least 20 Indians were killed by Saudi-led coalition air strikes on fuel smugglers at Yemen’s Hodeidah port on Tuesday, residents and fishermen said.
They said two boats were hit in the attack on an area called al-Khokha near Hodeidah port.
Verifying reports about killing of 20 Indians in Yemen: MEA
Ministry of External Affairs tonight said it has no information about the reports that 20 Indians have been killed in Saudi-led strikes in Yemen.
“We are ascertaining the facts about the reports,” MEA spokesman Vikas Swarup said when asked about reports that 20 Indians had been killed in Saudi-led strikes in Yemen.
Some media reports, quoting residents and fishermen, earlier claimed that at least 20 Indian nationals were killed in air strikes by Saudi-led coalition forces on fuel smugglers at Yemen’s Hodeidah port today.
They claimed two boats were hit in the attack on an area called al-Khokha near Hodeidah port.
India does not have Embassy in Yemen, which was shut down in April after evacuation of its nationals.
 08, 2015 9:44 pm
